segments.content: OM! Homage to the venerable noble lady Tārā! Homage to Tārā, the swift heroine,
Whose eyes are like a flash of lightning.
Who arose from the opening stamens of the lotus-face of the Protector of the Three Worlds.
Homage to her whose face is like a hundred full autumn moons gathered together,
Shining with the brilliant light of a thousand gathered stars.
Homage to her, golden-blue, hand adorned with a water-born lotus; whose sphere of action is generosity, diligence, austerity, peace, patience, and meditation.
Homage to her, the Tathāgata's crown protuberance, who enjoys limitless, complete victory.
Having attained every single perfection, she is deeply revered by the Children of the Victors.
Homage to her who, with TUTTĀRA and HŪṂ, fills the realms of desire, the directions, and space.
Trampling the seven worlds underfoot, she is able to summon all beings without exception.
Homage to her, whom Indra, Agni, Brahmā, Vāyu, and the varied mighty ones all worship.
Praised from the front by the hosts of spirits, risen-corpses, gandharvas, and yakṣas.
Homage to her who with TRAṬ and PHAṬ utterly destroys the magical wheels of others; with right leg bent and left extended, she tramples them underfoot.
In a maelstrom of fire, intensely blazing; Homage to TURE, the great and fearsome one, who utterly vanquishes the warriors of Māra.
Her lotus-face marked with a wrathful frown, she slays all foes without a single one remaining.
Homage to her, whose fingers at her heart display the mudrā of the Three Jewels,
Adorned with a wheel of every direction, from which swirls a great mass of her own light.
Homage to her, resplendent in supreme joy, whose crown emits a garland of light.
With the great joyful laughter of TUTTĀRA, she brings demons and the world under her power.
Homage to her, with the power to summon the entire assembly of protectors of the earth.
Frowning wrathfully, by the syllable HŪṂ she brings complete liberation from all poverty.
Homage to her, crowned with a crescent moon, all her ornaments intensely blazing.
With Amitābha in her topknot, from whom she eternally sends forth great rays of light.
Homage to her who dwells in the center of a blazing garland, like the fire at the end of an eon.
With right leg extended and left bent, she rejoices in the surrounding retinue, utterly destroying the armies of her foes.
Homage to her who strikes the surface of the earth with her palm and stomps upon it with her foot.
With wrathful glance and the syllable HŪṂ, she crushes all seven levels.
Homage to the blissful, virtuous, and peaceful one, whose sphere of action is the peace of nirvana.
Perfectly endowed with SVĀHĀ and OṂ, she is the one who overcomes great wrongdoing.
Homage to her, surrounded by a retinue of the truly joyous, who shatters the bodies of foes, having arrayed the ten-syllable mantra.
The Liberator herself, from the awareness-syllable HŪṂ.
Homage to her who stamps her foot with TURE, whose seed syllable is in the form of HŪṂ,
Shaking Mount Meru, Mandara, and Vindhya, and causing the three worlds to tremble.
Homage to her who holds in her hand a moon marked like a deer, in the form of a celestial lake.
By twice saying TĀRĀ and uttering PHAṬ, she completely dispels all poisons.
Homage to her, whom the hosts of gods, their kings, and the kinnaras all attend.
By the splendor of her joyous, all-encompassing armor,
She dispels all disputes and bad dreams.
Homage to her whose two eyes, like the full sun and moon, shine with brilliant light; by uttering HARA twice and TUTTĀRE, she dispels the most terrible plagues.
Homage to her, who is arrayed with the three ultimate truths,
Perfectly endowed with the power of peace; TURE, the most supreme, who vanquishes the hosts of demons, risen-corpses, and yakṣas.
This is the praise of the root mantra, and these are the twenty-one homages.
